name: sfchronicle
text:
Wolfman Books, a narrow Oakland storefront and cultural center that closed permanently in July, will soon be resurrected by the store’s former employees.

@SamWhitingSF has more here: https://t.co/Hj27ECcZCH

name: sfchronicle
text: The reopening of Alcatraz on Monday offers a bit of hope for San Francisco’s badly shaken tourist economy. https://t.co/EuURBoLKAE

name: sfchronicle
text: Between canceled standardized tests, virtual college tours and online classes, the admissions process for the Bay Area’s new high school seniors is swirling with even more uncertainty than usual. https://t.co/WW8RphnwXV

name: sfchronicle
text: State fire officials aren’t flinching at the prospect of searing temperatures in the coming days. But with many looking to escape into the outdoors after sheltering in place, firefighters have to confront an added set of risks. https://t.co/fC6fdCaYVD

name: sfchronicle
text: “We need someone in Sacramento we can count on 100% of the time, not 50%,” @JackieFielder_ said in an interview. “Now is the time for bolder changes.” https://t.co/M3WJE18IPN

name: sfchronicle
text: San Jose housing officials reminded residents of their rights during the coronavirus eviction moratorium. If residents can't pay rent, landlords are not allowed to charge interest or late fees. The moratorium is in effect through Aug. 31. https://t.co/KsNcz2Rczp

name: sfchronicle
text: Temperatures are expected to hit triple digits in the Bay Area this weekend, a major worry for health officers who foresee crowds of beachgoers spreading more sickness around the region. https://t.co/UuCYB5eV4d

name: sfchronicle
text:
In a video message, U.S. Surgeon General Jerome Adams advised people to prioritze their mental health during the coronavirus pandemic. 

“So make sure you’re building in time for activities you find enjoyable, and that help you relieve stress,” Adams said. https://t.co/UX3eMpwI2j

name: sfchronicle
text: Oracle Park’s out-of-work food-service employees, members of UNITE HERE Local 2, plan to hold a socially-distanced picket in Willie Mays Plaza, and a car caravan, “to protest SF Giants’ Greed” on Friday. https://t.co/fSa2kPRpXM
